content.question: The regions bounded by the graphs of <math alttext="y equals 6 x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y equals, 5 times x squared, minus x cubed" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> are shaded in the figure above. The graphs intersect at <math alttext="x equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="x equals 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="x equals 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following gives the sum of the areas of the shaded regions?

choices.label: <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 3, of, open parenthesis, 6 x, minus, open parenthesis, 5 times x squared, minus x cubed, close parenthesis, close parenthesis, d x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 2, of, open parenthesis, 6 x, minus, open parenthesis, 5 times x squared, minus x cubed, close parenthesis, close parenthesis, d x, plus, the integral from, 2 to 3, of, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, 5 times x squared, minus x cubed, close parenthesis, minus 6 x, close parenthesis, d x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 2, of, open parenthesis, 5 times x squared, minus x cubed, close parenthesis, d x, plus, the integral from, 2 to 3, of, 6 x, d x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mo>+</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 2, of, 6 x, d x, plus, the integral from, 2 to 3, of, open parenthesis, 5 times x squared, minus x cubed, close parenthesis, d x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mo>+</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 2, of, open parenthesis, 6 x, minus, open parenthesis, 5 times x squared, minus x cubed, close parenthesis, close parenthesis, d x, plus, the integral from, 2 to 3, of, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, 5 times x squared, minus x cubed, close parenthesis, minus 6 x, close parenthesis, d x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 8.6: Finding the Area Between Curves That Intersect at More Than Two Points

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
